English: And it came to pass in those days , that Jesus <came from Nazareth of Galilee> , and was baptized of John in Jordan .
Basque: Egun heietarik batez, Jesus <Galileako Nazaretetik etorri zen>, eta Joanesek Jordanean bataiatu zuen.

English: And straightway <coming up out of the water>, he saw the heavens opened , and the Spirit like a dove descending upon him :
Basque: <Uretik ateratzean>, Jesusek zerua urratzen ikusi zuen eta Izpiritua, uso bat bezala, bereganat jausten.

English: And Jesus rebuked him , saying , Hold thy peace , and <come out of him> .
Basque: Jesusek larderiatu zuen: –Ago ixilik, eta <gizon hortarik atera hadi>!
remarks: Today -tatik & -tarik are considered allomorphs, but actually -rik is the old partitive marker which expressed SOURCE. Interestingly, in this example the source is not encoded with animacy marker.

English: And when the unclean spirit had torn him , and cried with a loud voice , he <came out of him>.
Basque: Izpiritu gaixtoak inarrosi zuen gogorki, eta orro bat eginez, <hartarik atera zen>.
remarks: Today -tatik & -tarik are considered allomorphs, but actually -rik is the old partitive marker which expressed SOURCE. Interestingly, in this example the source is not encoded with animacy marker.

English: And forthwith , when they were <come out of the synagogue> , they entered into the house of Simon and Andrew , with James and John .
Basque: Jesus, sinagogatik atera bezain laster, Simon eta Andreren etxerat joan zen, Jakobe eta Joanirekin.

English: But Jesus withdrew himself with his disciples to the sea : and a great <multitude from Galilee followed him>, and from Judaea
Basque: Jesus laku-bazterrerat joan zen bere dizipuluekin. <Galileatik jendetze handia jarraiki zitzaion>.
remarks: In Northern Basque translation Galilee is the SOURCE for the verb FOLLOW, rather than the origin of the multitude who followed Jesus.

English: But Jesus withdrew himself with his disciples to the sea : and a great multitude from Galilee followed him, and <from Judaea>
Basque: Eta harek egiten zituenak entzunik, <Judea, Jerusalem, Idumea, Jordanez hainditik>, Tir eta Sidon aldetik ere jendetze handia etorri zitzaion.
remarks: Basque translation differs from King Jame's version. The ABL marker governs the whole list of places, which includes Judaea.

English: And <from Jerusalem> , and from Idumaea , and from beyond Jordan ; and they about Tyre and Sidon , a great multitude , when they had heard what great things he did , came unto him .
Basque: Eta harek egiten zituenak entzunik, <Judea, Jerusalem, Idumea, Jordanez hainditik>, Tir eta Sidon aldetik ere jendetze handia etorri zitzaion.
remarks: Basque translation differs from King Jame's version. The ABL marker governs the whole list of places, which includes Jerusalem.

English: And from Jerusalem, and <from Idumaea> , and from beyond Jordan ; and they about Tyre and Sidon , a great multitude , when they had heard what great things he did , came unto him .
Basque: Eta berak egiten zituenak entzunik, <Judea, Jerusalem, Idumea, Jordanez bestalde eta Tiro eta Sidon aldetik> ere jende-talde handia bildu zitzaion.
remarks: Basque translation differs from King Jame's version. The ABL marker governs the whole list of places, which includes Idumaea.

English: And from Jerusalem , and from Idumaea , and <from beyond Jordan> ; and they about Tyre and Sidon , a great multitude , when they had heard what great things he did , came unto him .
Basque: Eta berak egiten zituenak entzunik, <Judea, Jerusalem, Idumea, Jordanez bestalde eta Tiro eta Sidon aldetik> ere jende-talde handia bildu zitzaion.

English: And the scribes which <came down from Jerusalem> said , He hath Beelzebub , and by the prince of the devils casteth he out devils .
Basque: <Jerusalemdik jautsi> lege-irakasleek, berriz, zioten: «Beeltzebulek hartua da», eta «Debruen buruzagiaren indarrez haizatzen ditu debruak».
remarks: –dik is a phonologically conditioned allomorph of –tik

English: And when he was <come out of the ship> , immediately there met him out of the tombs a man with an unclean spirit ,
Basque: Jesus <untzitik jaustean>, izpiritu gaixto batek hartu gizon bat hilobietarik atera zitzaion biderat.

English: And when he was come out of the ship , immediately there <met him out of the tombs> a man with an unclean spirit ,
Basque: Jesus untzitik jaustean, izpiritu gaixto batek hartu gizon bat <hilobietarik atera zitzaion biderat>.
remarks: ABL marker is added to the postposition arte 'between'; lit. '[a man] came out [to Jesus] from between [the] tombs'.

English: For he said unto him , <Come out of the man >, thou unclean spirit .
Basque: Alabainan, Jesusek erraiten zion: «<Gizon hortarik atera hadi>, izpiritu gaixtoa!»
remarks: Today -tatik & -tarik are considered allomorphs, but actually -rik is the old partitive marker which expressed SOURCE. Interestingly, in this example the source is not encoded with animacy marker.

English: And he besought him much that he would not <send them away out of the country>.
Basque: Eta otoizka eskatzen zion <lurralde hartarik kanporat igor ez zitzan>.
gloss: territory that.OBL-ABL away send NEG AUX

English: And they began to pray him to <depart out of their coasts>.
Basque: Orduan, <heien lurraldetik urrunt zadin> otoiztu zuten Jesus.

English: And Jesus , immediately knowing in himself that virtue <had gone out of him>, turned him about in the press , and said , Who touched my clothes ?
Basque: Jesus berehala ohartu zen halako indar bat atera zitzaiola eta, jendartean itzulirik, galdatu zuen: –Nork hunki dauzkit soinekoak?
remarks: Basque translation does not explicitly encode SOURCE.

English: While he yet spake , there <came from the ruler of the synagogue's house> certain which said , Thy daughter is dead : why troublest thou the Master any further ?
Basque: Oraino mintzo zela, <sinagogako buruzagiaren etxetik> zenbait etorri ziren erraitera: «Alaba hil zaizu. Zertako neka zinezake oraino Irakasle jauna?»

English: And he said unto them , In what place soever ye enter into an house , there abide till ye <depart from that place>.
Basque: Erran zioten ere: «Etxe batean sartuko zireztenean, zaudezte han <herri hartarik atera> arte.

English: And the people saw them departing , and many knew him , and <ran afoot thither out of all cities>, and outwent them , and came together unto him .
Basque: Bainan jendeek joaiten ikusi eta ainitzek ezagutu zituzten. Oinez <herri guzietarik leku hartarat laster egin zuten>, aitzintzen zituztela.
gloss: village all-PL-ABL place that.OBL-ALL hurry do QUX

English: And when they were <come out of the ship>, straightway they knew him ,
Basque: <Untzitik atera zireneko>, jendeak Jesus ezagutu zuen,

English: Then came together unto him the Pharisees , and certain of the scribes , which <came from Jerusalem> .
Basque: Jesusen ondorat bildu ziren farisauek eta <Jerusalemdik etorri> lege-irakasle zenbaitek
remarks: –dik is a phonologically conditioned allomorph of –tik

English: There is nothing <from without a man>, that entering into him can defile him : but the things which come out of him , those are they that defile the man .
Basque: Ez da deus, <kanpotik> jendearen barnerat sartuz, hura lohi dezakeenik; barnetik ateratzen zaionak du jendea lohitzen».

English: There is nothing from without a man, that entering into him can defile him : but the things which <come out of him> , those are they that defile the man .
Basque: Ez da deus, kanpotik jendearen barnerat sartuz, hura lohi dezakeenik; <barnetik ateratzen zaionak> du jendea lohitzen».

English: And he said , That which <cometh out of the man>, that defileth the man .
Basque: Eta erran zuen oraino: – <Jendeaganik ateratzen> denak, harek du jendea lohitzen! 2

English: For <from within>, out of the heart of men , proceed evil thoughts , adulteries , fornications , murders ,
Basque: Alabainan, <barnetik>, jendeen bihotzetik ateratzen dira arrazoin gaixto, lizunkeria, ohointza, hilketa,

English: For from within , <out of the heart> of men , proceed evil thoughts , adulteries , fornications , murders ,
Basque: Alabainan, barnetik, <jendeen bihotzetik> ateratzen dira arrazoin gaixto, lizunkeria, ohointza, hilketa,

English: All these evil things <come from within>, and defile the man .
Basque: Tzarkeria horiek guziak <barnetik ateratzen dira>, eta jendea lohitzen dute.

English: The woman was a Greek , a Syrophenician by nation ; and she besought him that he would <cast forth the devil out of her daughter>.
Basque: Emaztea paganoa zen, feniziarra, eta debrua <bere alabaganik haiza zezan> galdegiten zion Jesusi.
remarks: With animate nouns the sequence can be either NOUN-DET-GEN-ANIM-ABL or NOUN-DET-ANIM-ABL

English: And he said unto her , For this saying go thy way ; the devil <is gone out of thy daughter> .
Basque: Orduan, Jesusek: –Ele horrengatik, zoazi; <debrua zure alabaganik atera da>.

English: And again , <departing from the coasts of Tyre> and Sidon , he came unto the sea of Galilee , through the midst of the coasts of Decapolis .
Basque: <Tireko lurraldetik atera> eta Sidonen barna, Galileako lakualde joan zen berriz, Dekapolisko lurraldean gaindi.

English: And if I send them away fasting to their own houses , they will faint by the way : for divers of them <came from far>.
Basque: Etxerat barurik igortzen baditut, ahuleziak joko ditu bidean; zenbait <urrunetik etorriak dira>.

English: And he took the blind man by the hand , and led him <out of the town>; and when he had spit on his eyes , and put his hands upon him , he asked him if he saw ought .
Basque: Jesusek itsua eskutik hartu eta <herritik kanporat> ereman zuen. Begiak tuz perekatu ondoan, eskuak gainean ezarri ziozkan eta galdatu: –Zerbait ikusten duzu?

English: And there was a cloud that overshadowed them : and a voice <came out of the cloud>, saying , This is my beloved Son : hear him .
Basque: Orduan, hodei batek estali zituen eta mintzo bat <izan zen hodeitik>: «Hau da nere seme maitea. Entzun zazue!»
remarks: Source is expressed, but without a verb of mouvement. in Old Basque the verb TO BE, when used together with ABL or ALL cases, could express mouvement. Northern dialects have preserved this archaism.

English: When Jesus saw that the people came running together , he rebuked the foul spirit , saying unto him , Thou dumb and deaf spirit , I charge thee , <come out of him> , and enter no more into him .
Basque: Jendaldea metatzen ari zela ikusirik, Jesusek izpiritu gaixtoa mehatxatu zuen: –Izpiritu mutu eta elkorra, nik manatzen daiat: <haur hortarik atera hadi> eta ez gehiago sar horren baitan.

English: And they came to Jericho : and as he <went out of Jericho> with his disciples and a great number of people , blind Bartimaeus , the son of Timaeus , sat by the highway side begging .
Basque: Jerikorat heldu ziren. Eta Jesus bere dizipuluekin eta jende alde batekin <Jerikotik ateratzean>, Timeoren seme, Bartime, eskale itsua, bide-bazterrean jarririk zagon.

English: And on the morrow , when they were <come from Bethany> , he was hungry :
Basque: Biharamunean, <Betaniatik ateratzean>, Jesus gose zen.

English: And when even was come , he <went out of the city> .
Basque: Arratsean, Jesus eta dizipuluak <hiritik atera ziren>.

English: And they took him , and killed him , and <cast him out of the vineyard >.
Basque: Hartu, hil eta <mahastitik kanporat bota zuten>.

English: And as he <went out of the temple> , one of his disciples saith unto him , Master , see what manner of stones and what buildings are here !
Basque: Jesus <tenplutik ateratzean>, bere dizipuluetarik batek erran zion: –Irakasle jauna, so egizu nolako harriak eta nolako eraikinak!

English: Now when Jesus was risen early the first day of the week , he appeared first to Mary Magdalene , <out of whom he had cast seven devils> .
Basque: Asteko lehen egun goizean pizturik, Jesus lehenik Magdalako Mariari agertu zitzaion, <zazpi debru haizatu ziozkanari>.
remarks: Basque translation uses the DATIVE to express SOURCE, lit. 'to whom he cast seven devils'.

English: And he said , Abba , Father , all things are possible unto thee ; <take away this cup from me> : nevertheless not what I will , but what thou wilt
Basque: Erraiten zuen: «Abba, Aita! Zuk oro egiten ahal duzu; <bazter zazu nereganik edari samin hau>! Halere, ez nik nahi dutana, baizik zuk nahi duzuna».

English: No man also seweth a piece of new cloth on an old garment : else the new piece that filled it up <taketh away from the old> , and the rent is made worse .
Basque: Nihork ez dio soineko zaharrari oihal berrizko petatxurik josten; bestela, puska berria zaharrari tiraka aritzen zaio eta urradura handiagotzen da.
remarks: Basque translation differs. ≈ 'The new piece would force the old coth and make a bigger hole'.

English: And when he was entered into the house <from the people> , his disciples asked him concerning the parable .
Basque: <Jendeetarik> urrun, etxean sartu zelarik, hitz horiek zer erran nahi zuten galdatu zioten dizipuluek.
remarks: ABL marker is added without the animacy marker to the word 'people', because the relevant semantic content is 'multitude' as a mass.

English: And the spirit cried , and rent him sore , and <came out of him>: and he was as one dead ; insomuch that many said , He is dead .
Basque: Oihuka eta zalapartaka <atera zen> izpiritu gaixtoa. Haurra hilik bezala gelditu zen. Ainitzek hila zela zioten;
remarks: SOURCE is omitted in the Basuqe translation.

English: And at the season he sent to the husbandmen a servant , that he might <receive from the husbandmen> of the fruit of the vineyard .
Basque: Sasoina etorri zenean, mutil bat igorri zioten mahastizaineri, mahastiaren fruituetarik parte bat <heienganik altxatzeko>.

English: And let him that is on the housetop not go down into the house , neither enter therein , to <take any thing out of his house> :
Basque: etxegainean izanen dena ez bedi jauts, etxean ez bedi sar zerbaiten hartzeko,

English: And he left the linen cloth , and <fled from them> naked .
Basque: Bainan oihala utzi eta biluzik ihes egin zuen.

English: And Peter <followed him afar off> , even into the palace of the high priest : and he sat with the servants , and warmed himself at the fire .
Basque: Petri <urrundik jarraiki zitzaion>, apezburuaren jauregi barneraino. Eta mutilekin jarririk zagon, su ondoan berotzen.

English: But he went out , and began to publish it much , and to blaze abroad the matter , insomuch that Jesus could no more openly enter into the city , but was without in desert places : and they <came to him from every quarter> .
Basque: Hura, atera orduko, gertatu zenaren goraki oihukatzen eta zabaltzen hasi zen. Horrengatik, Jesus ez zaitekeen agerian sar herri batean; kanpoan egoiten zen, bazterlekuetan. Halere <jendea nun-nahitik etortzen zitzaion>.
remarks: –dik is a phonologically conditioned allomorph of –tik

English: And he <went out from thence> , and came into his own country ; and his disciples follow him .
Basque: <Handik atera> eta bere herrirat joan zen Jesus; dizipuluak jarraiki zitzaizkion.
remarks: –dik is a phonologically conditioned allomorph of –tik

English: And <from thence he arose>, and went into the borders of Tyre and Sidon , and entered into an house , and would have no man know it : but he could not be hid .
Basque: <Handik>, Tireko lurralderat joan zen Jesus. Etxe batean sartu zen, eta ez zuen nahi nehork jakin zezan; bainan ezin izan zuen gordean egon.
remarks: –dik is a phonologically conditioned allomorph of –tik

English: And he <took him aside from the multitude>, and put his fingers into his ears , and he spit , and touched his tongue ;
Basque: Jesusek, <jendearenganik berex harturik>, eriak beharrietan ezarri ziozkan, eta tuarekin mihia hunki.

English: And he <arose from thence>, and cometh into the coasts of Judaea by the farther side of Jordan : and the people resort unto him again ; and , as he was wont , he taught them again .
Basque: <Handik ateraturik>, Jesus Judeako lurralderat, Jordanez bestalderat joan zen. Berriz jendaldeak bildu zitzaizkion ondorat, eta bera, ohi zuen bezala, berriz irakasten hasi zitzaioten
remarks: –dik is a phonologically conditioned allomorph of –tik

English: And then shall he send his angels , and shall gather together his elect <from the four winds> , from the uttermost part of the earth to the uttermost part of heaven .
Basque: Orduan, aingeruak igorri eta bere hautetsiak bilduko ditu <lau haizeetarik>, lurraren hegal batetik zeruaren beste hegaleraino.

English: And then shall he send his angels , and shall gather together his elect from the four winds , <from the uttermost part of the earth> to the uttermost part of heaven .
Basque: Orduan, aingeruak igorri eta bere hautetsiak bilduko ditu lau haizeetarik, <lurraren hegal batetik zeruaren beste hegaleraino>.
remarks: Basque translation differs. The idea is ≈ 'from on end of the Earth until the other'.

English: And immediately , while he yet spake , cometh Judas , one of the twelve , and with him a great multitude with swords and staves ,<from the chief priests> and the scribes and the elders .
Basque: Eta berehala, Jesus mintzo zelarik oraino, han agertu zen Judas, Hamabietarik bat, eta jendalde bat harekin, ezpata eta makilak eskuetan, apezburu, lege-irakasle eta zaharrek igorririk.
remarks: Basque paraphrases like this: 'Sent BY the chief priests, the scribes and the elders". In this construction, what in English version is SOURCE becomes AGENT, and it is expressed by means of the ergative case.

English: And they said among themselves , Who shall <roll us away the stone from the door> of the sepulchre ?
Basque: Elkarren artean ari ziren: «Nork <itzulikatuko dauku hilobiaren sargiako harria>?»
remarks: Relational suffix -ko, whose general meaning is 'of'.

English: And they went out quickly , and <fled from the sepulchre> ; for they trembled and were amazed : neither said they any thing to any man ; for they were afraid .
Basque: Emazteek <hilobitik atera eta ihes egin zuten>, ikaran eta harriturik; eta nehori ez zioten deusik erran, beldur baitziren.
gloss: tomb-ABL go_out and escape do AUX

English: And there <came a voice from heaven> , saying , Thou art my beloved Son , in whom I am well pleased .
Basque: Eta <zerutikako mintzo bat> entzun zen: «Zu zaitut neure seme maitea, zu zaitut atsegin».
remarks: Agglutination of the elational suffix -ko upon the ABL allomorph -tika. In this Northern Basque translation the ABL marker is enough to encode movement, so "zerutikako mintzo bat" means "a voice [which came] from Heaven".

English: And when they <come from the market> , except they wash , they eat not . And many other things there be , which they have received to hold , as the washing of cups , and pots , brasen vessels , and of tables .
Basque: <Plazatik etxeratzean> ere ez dute jaten beren buruen garbiketa egin gabe; eta beste gauza ainitzi ere ohiduraz atxikiak dira, hala nola kopa, pitxer eta untzien garbitzeari.

English: And the Pharisees came forth , and began to question with him , seeking of him <a sign from heaven> , tempting him .
Basque: Farisauak etorri eta Jesusekin eztabadan hasi ziren, <Jainkoarenganikako seinale bat> eskatuz: hutsean atzeman nahi zuten.
remarks: Agglutination of ABL marker -(r)ik(a) + relational suffix -ko, because in the sentence SOURCE is used as an adjectival structure, and the head of the NP is a sign.

English: And as they <came down from the mountain>, he charged them that they should tell no man what things they had seen , till the Son of man were risen from the dead .
Basque: <Menditik jaustean>, ikusi zutena nehori ez aipatzeko manatu zioten, gizonaren semea hiletarik piztu arte.

English: And when they had mocked him , they <took off the purple from him>, and put his own clothes on him , and led him out to crucify him .
Basque: Trufatu ondoan, soineko gorria erantzi eta bere soinekoez jantzi zuten. Gero, kanporat ereman zuten gurutzean itzatzeko.

English: And they compel one Simon a Cyrenian , who passed by , <coming out of the country>, the father of Alexander and Rufus , to bear his cross .
Basque: <Landetarik etxerat> zoan bat, Simon Zirenekoa (Alexandro eta Ruforen aita), Jesusen gurutzearen eremaitera bortxatu zuten.

English: Save thyself , and <come down from the cross>.
Basque: salba zak heure burua! <Jauts hadi gurutzetik>!»

English: Let Christ the King of Israel <descend now from the cross> , that we may see and believe . And they that were crucified with him reviled him .
Basque: Mesias Israelgo erregea <jauts dadila orai gurutzetik>, ikus eta sinets dezagun». Harekin gurutzitzatuek ere laido egiten zioten.

English: And the veil of the temple <was rent in twain from the top to the bottom>.
Basque: Orduan, tenpluko oihala <bi pusketan urratu zen, gainetik behereraino>.
gloss: two piece.PL-INE rent-PFV was top-ABL bottom-TERM

English: And he came and <took her by the hand>, and lifted her up.
Basque: Hurbildurik, jeikarazi zuen <eskutik hartuz>: sukarrak utzi zuen eta zerbitzatzen hasi zitzaioten.
remarks: PROLATIVE

English: And in the morning, rising up a great while before day, <he went out>, and departed into a solitary place, and there prayed.
Basque: Goizean, oraino ilun beltza zelarik, Jesus jeiki zen, <herritik atera> eta bazterleku baterat joan; han otoitzean ari zen.

English: they uncovered the roof where he was: and when they had broken it up, they let down the bed wherein the sick of the palsy lay.
Basque: Bainan jendaldeagatik ezin baitzuten Jesusenganaino ereman, hura zagon parean etxegaina urratu eta <zilotik beheiti jautsi zuten> parlesiatua etzanik zagon ohetxoa.
remarks: PROLATIVE.

English: When she had heard of Jesus, <came in the press behind>, and touched his garment.
Basque: Jesusez erraiten zena entzunik, <jendartean gibeletik joan> eta soinekoa hunki zion,
remarks: PROLATIVE

English: And he <took the damsel by the hand>, and said unto her:
Basque: <Haurra eskutik hartu> eta erran zion: «Talitha kum» (erran nahi baita: «Nexka, nik diozut: iratzar zaite»).
remarks: PROLATIVE

English: <John the Baptist was risen from the dead>, and therefore mighty works do shew forth themselves in him.
Basque: Herodes erregeak Jesusen berri jakin zuen, haren omena zabaldu baitzen. Batzuk zioten: «<Joanes Bataiatzailea hiletarik piztu da>; hortako ditu mirakuluak egiten».
gloss: John the Baptist dead-PL-ABL revive.PFV AUX

English: And Jesus, <when he came out>, saw much people
Basque: <Untzitik jautsi zenean>, jendalde handia ikusi zuen Jesusek. Urrikaldu zitzaioten, artzainik gabeko ardiak bezala baitziren, eta gauza ainitzen irakasten hasi zitzaioten.
remarks: SOURCE is not expressed in the English version.

English: And he saith unto them, Are ye so without understanding also? Do ye not perceive, that whatsoever thing <from without> entereth into the man, it cannot defile him;
Basque: Jesusek erran zioten: –Zuek ere adimendurik gabeak zirezte? Ez duzue konprenitzen <kanpotik> sartzen zaion deusek ez dezakeela jendea lohi,

English: And <he took the blind man by the hand>, and led him out of the town; and when he had spit on his eyes , and put his hands upon him , he asked him if he saw ought .
Basque: <Jesusek itsua eskutik hartu> eta herritik kanporat ereman zuen. Begiak tuz perekatu ondoan, eskuak gainean ezarri ziozkan eta galdatu: –Zerbait ikusten duzu?
remarks: PROLATIVE

English: And as they came down from the mountain, he charged them that they should tell no man what things they had seen , <till the Son of man were risen from the dead>.
Basque: <Menditik jaustean>, ikusi zutena nehori ez aipatzeko manatu zioten, <gizonaren semea hiletarik piztu arte>.

English: And they kept that saying with themselves, questioning one with another what <the rising from the dead> should mean.
Basque: Manu hori begiratu zuten, elkarren artean eztabada zutela «<hiletarik piztea>» zer ote zen.

English: But <Jesus took him by the hand>, and lifted him up; and he arose.
Basque: bainan <Jesusek eskutik hartu> eta jeikiarazirik, xutitu zen.
remarks: PROLATIVE

English: And whosoever shall offend one of these little ones that believe in me, it is better for him that <a millstone were hanged about his neck>, and he were cast into the sea.
Basque: Sinesten duten ttipi hauetarik bakar baten fedea galbidean ezartzen duenak, hobe luke <harri handi bat lepotik dilindan> itsasorat bota balezate.
remarks: PROLATIVE

English: It is easier for a camel to go <through the eye of a needle>, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.
Basque: Kamelua <orratzaren begitik> pasatzea errexago, aberatsa Jainkoaren erresuman sartzea baino.
remarks: PROLATIVE

English: But Jesus said unto them, Ye know not what ye ask: can ye drink <of the cup> that I drink of? and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?
Basque: Jesusek erran zioten: –Zer eskatzen duzuen ez dakizue. On ote zirezte nik edanen dutan <edari saminetik> edateko, edo ni sartuko naizen sofrikario uretan sartzeko?
remarks: PARTITIVE

English: And they said unto him, We can. And Jesus said unto them, Ye shall indeed drink of the cup that I drink of; and with the baptism that I am baptized withal shall ye be baptized:
Basque: –On gira –erran zioten. Jesusek, orduan: –Nik edanen dutan <edari saminetik> edanen duzue, bai, eta ni sartuko naizen sofrikario uretan sartuko ere;
remarks: PARTITIVE

English: And <seeing a fig tree afar> off having leaves, he came, if haply he might find any thing thereon: and when he came to it, he found nothing but leaves; for the time of figs was not yet.
Basque: Hostotan zen pikondo bat <urrunetik ikusirik>, hartan zerbait aurkituko ote zuen joan zen; bainan haratu eta hostorik baizik ez zuen aurkitu, ez baitzen piko-sasoina.

English: For verily I say unto you, That whosoever shall say unto this mountain, <Be thou removed>, and be thou cast into the sea; and shall not doubt in his heart, but shall believe that those things which he saith shall come to pass; he shall have whatsoever he saith.
Basque: Egiaz diozuet: norbaitek mendi huni erraiten badio: «<Ken hortik> eta jauzi egizak itsasorat», eta erraiten duena gertatuko dela sinesten badu bere baitan duda-mudarik gabe, ardietsiko du.
remarks: SOURCE is not expressed in the English version.

English: And at the season he sent to the husbandmen a servant, that he might receive from the husbandmen <of the fruit of the vineyard>.
Basque: Sasoina etorri zenean, mutil bat igorri zioten mahastizaineri, <mahastiaren fruituetarik> parte bat heienganik altxatzeko.
remarks: PARTITIVE

English: And when Jesus saw that he answered discreetly, he said unto him, Thou art not <far from the kingdom of God>. And no man after that durst ask him any question.
Basque: Zuhurki ihardetsi zuela ikusirik, Jesusek erran zion: –Ez zira <Jainkoaren erresumatik urrun>.
remarks: DISTANCE

English: For all they did cast in <of their abundance>; but she of her want did cast in all that she had, even all her living.
Basque: Ezen beste guziek <beren soberakinetik> ezarri dute; horrek, aldiz, bere eskasiatik, zaukan guzia, bizitzeko behar zuen guzia ezarri du».
remarks: PARTITIVE

English: For all they did cast in of their abundance; but she of her want did cast in all that she had, even all her living.
Basque: Ezen beste guziek beren soberakinetik ezarri dute; horrek, aldiz, <bere eskasiatik>, zaukan guzia, bizitzeko behar zuen guzia ezarri du».
remarks: Metaphorical SOURCE o PARTITIVE?

English: For in those days shall be affliction, such as was not <from the beginning of the creation> which God created unto this time, neither shall be.
Basque: Zeren egun heietan nahigabe handia izanen baita, Jainkoak mundua kreatu zuen <haste hartarik> orai arte gertatu eta gehiago gertatuko ez den bezalakoa.
remarks: TIME

English: But take ye heed: behold, I have foretold you all things.
Basque: Zuek, beraz, kasu egizue! Denak <aitzinetik> erran dauzkizuet.
remarks: TIME

English: And the stars of heaven shall fall, and the powers that are in heaven shall be shaken.
Basque: izarrak <zerutik> erortzen hasiko dira eta kordokatuko zeruetako indarrak.
remarks: Basque example expresses SOURCE of the verb FALL.

English: For it might have been sold <for more than three hundred pence>, and have been given to the poor. And they murmured against her.
Basque: <Hiru ehun denarioz goiti> sal zitekeen eta saria behartsueri eman. Eta kexu ziren emazteaz.
remarks: PROLATIVE

English: She hath done what she could: she is come <aforehand> to anoint my body to the burying.
Basque: Ahal zuena egin du: nere gorputza usaingozoztatu du <aitzinetik>, ehorzketarako.
remarks: TIME

English: And he answered and said unto them, It is one of the twelve, that dippeth with me in the dish.
Basque: Jesusek ihardetsi: –Hamabietarik batek, nerekin <untzi beretik> jaten ari denak.
remarks: PARTITIVE

English:
And one ran and filled a spunge full of vinegar, and put it on a reed, and gave
him to drink, saying, Let alone; let us see whether Elias will come <to take him down>.
Basque: Orduan, norbait lasterka joan zen, mustuka bat ozpinez bete eta, kanabera baten muturrean ezarririk, edatera eman zion, erranez: «Bego, ea Elias <hortik jaustera> etorriko zaion».
remarks: SOURCE is not expressed in the English version.

English: There were also women <looking on afar off>: among whom was Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the less and of Joses, and Salome;
Basque: Emazte batzu ere baziren han, <urrunetik so>; heien artean, Magdalako Maria, Jakobe gaztearen eta Josesen ama Maria, eta Salome,

English: And he bought fine linen, and <took him down>, and wrapped him in the linen, and laid him in a sepulchre which was hewn out of a rock, and rolled a stone unto the door of the sepulchre.
Basque: Hunek hil-mihise bat erosi zuen, Jesus <gurutzetik jautsi>, hil-mihiseaz inguratu eta harrokan zilatu hilobi batean ezarri. Gero harri bat itzulikatu zuen hilobi sartzearen hesteko.
remarks: SOURCE is not expressed in the English version.

English: And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear you, <when ye depart thence>, shake off the dust under your feet for a testimony against them. Verily I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment, than for that city.
Basque: nunbait ongi etorri egiten ez badauzuete, eta entzun nahi ere ez, <handik joaitean>, oinetako errautsa inarrosazue, heien kontrako lekukotzat».

English: He answered and said unto them, Well hath Esaias prophesied of you hypocrites, as it is written, This people honoureth me with their lips, but their heart is <far from me>.
Basque: Jesusek ihardetsi: –Itxurazaleak, zuek! Ederki mintzatu zen zuetaz Isaias profeta, hau idatzia baita: Herri hunek ezpainez ohoratzen nau, bainan bihotza <nereganik urrun> du;
remarks: DISTANCE

English: Because it entereth not into his heart, but into the belly, and goeth out into the draught, purging all meats?
Basque: ez baitzaio bihotzerat sartzen, sabelerat baizik, eta <handik> ongarri-zilorat.
remarks: SOURCE is not expressed in the English version.

English: And he asked his father, How long is it ago since this came unto him? And he said, <Of a child>.
Basque: Jesusek aitari galdatu zion: –Noizdanik gertatzen zaio hori? Harek ihardetsi: – <Haur-haurretik>.
remarks: TIME. The INANIMATE ABL marker -tik is added to the noun for CHILD, to convey a temporal value. Otherwise the ANIM marker would be needed.

English: And they <departed thence>, and passed through Galilee; and he would not that any man should know it.
Basque: <Handik> atera eta Galilean barna zoatzin. Jesusek ez zuen nahi nehork jakin zezan,

English: And he answered and said unto him, Master, all these have I observed <from my youth>.
Basque: Harek, orduan: –Irakasle jauna, <gazte-gaztetik> begiratu dut hori guzia.
remarks: TIME.

English: And they shall mock him, and shall scourge him, and shall spit upon him, and shall kill him: and the third day he shall rise again.
Basque: trufatuko dute, tu eginen diote, azotatu eta hilen dute; eta <handik hiru egunen buruan> piztuko da».
remarks: TIME

English: And in the morning, as they passed by, they saw the fig tree dried up from the roots.
Basque: Goizean, <handik> iragaitean, pikondoa erroetaraino eihartua ikusi zuten.
remarks: PROLATIVE

English: And preached, saying, There cometh one mightier than I <after me>, the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to stoop down and unloose.
Basque: Hau oihukatzen zuen: «<Nere ondotik> dator ni baino ahaltsuago dena, eta ni ez naiz on ukurtu eta haren oinetako lokarriaren laxatzeko ere.
remarks: TIME

English: And Jesus said unto them, Come ye <after me>, and I will make you to become fishers of men.
Basque: Jesusek erran zioten: «Zatozte <nere ondotik> eta jende arrantzale eginen zaituztet».
remarks: TIME

English: And straightway he called them: and they left their father Zebedee in the ship with the hired servants, and went <after him>.
Basque: Eta berehala dei egin zioten. Beren aita Zebedeo eta mutilak untzian utzirik, <Jesusen ondotik> joan ziren.
remarks: TIME

English: And he said unto her, Daughter, thy faith hath made thee whole; go in peace, and be whole <of thy plague>.
Basque: Jesusek erran zion: «Ene alaba, zeure fedeak salbatu zaitu; zoazi bakean, <zeure gaitzetik sendo>».
remarks: COMPLEMENT

English: And he charged them, saying, Take heed, <beware of the leaven of the Pharisees, and of the leaven of Herod>.
Basque: Jesusek gomendatu zioten: «Kasu! <Farisauen eta Herodesen altxagarritik begira zaitezte>!»
gloss: Pharisee-PL.GEN and Herod-GEN leaven-ABL beware IMP.2PL
remarks: COMPLEMENT

English: And Jesus answering said unto them, Do ye not therefore <err>, because ye know not the scriptures, neither the power of God?
Basque: Jesusek erran zioten: –Ez ote zabiltzate <bide makurretik>, Liburu Sainduak eta Jainkoaren ahala ezagutzen ez dituzuelakotz?
remarks: PARTITIVE

English: He is not the God of the dead, but the God of the living: ye therefore do greatly <err>.
Basque: Ez da hilen Jainkoa, biziena bai. Arrunt <bide makurretik> zabiltzate.
remarks: PARTITIVE

English: And they send unto him certain of the Pharisees and of the Herodians, to catch him <in his words>.
Basque: Farisau eta Herodesen alderdiko batzu igorri ziozkaten Jesusi, <eleetarik atzemaiteko>.
remarks: PARTITIVE

English: And again he sent unto them another servant; and at him they cast stones, and wounded him in the head, and sent him away shamefully handled.
Basque: Berriz beste mutil bat igorri zioten; hari <burutik beheiti> eman eta laidostatu zuten.
remarks: fixed expression, lit. 'from the top to the bottom'

English:
And a certain woman, which had an issue of blood twelve years, [26] And had suffered many things <of many physicians>, and had spent all that she
had, and was nothing bettered, but rather grew worse,
Basque: 25 Bazen han emazte bat, hamabi urte hartan odol-galtzeak zituena, 26 <mediku ainitzenganik> zernahi jasana, zituen guziak xahuturik batere hobekitu gabea, izaitekotan gaizkiago baizik ez zoana.

English: And he asked his father, <How long is it ago since> this came unto him? And he said, Of a child.
Basque: Jesusek aitari galdatu zion: – <Noizdanik> gertatzen zaio hori? Harek ihardetsi: – Haur-haurretik.
remarks: TIME. THe suffix -danik is an archaism preserved in Northern Basque. It is composed of the element -da(n)- and the partitive-ablative marker -(r)ik. This complex marker is added to adverbs of time.
